root: ^Not now. Remember the sign: "Each riddle has a solution"? It means there's a way out. We just need to find it. We could use something in this room.
^Andreas, I think it might be this casket of Pandora. There's a legend…
^Yeah, now’s a great time for stories! Andreas, I noticed something on the ceiling, look.

c-0: ^When Pandora opened the casket, she released all sorts of evil spirits and misfortunes. Apate was one of them, a goddess of deception. But hope was left in the bottom of the casket, unnoticed although it had always been there.
^Apparently, Apate symbolizes all the misfortunes in Pandora's casket. But among the misfortunes and trials, there's always hope.
c-1: ^On the ceiling, right above the casket, there are no spikes! If we remove the casket, we can stand where it stands now.
^What if it doesn't work? We need to solve the riddle and find the exit.
^Removing the casket is quicker. Andreas, give me a hand; the casket is heavy.
^Ok. On the count three we push.
